name: Neo-Psychedelia
description: Developments in Psychedelia since the early 1980s, building on the drug-inspired styles developed in the 1960s.

children.name: Baggy
children.description: Blends Dance and Funk-based grooves with a laid-back, psychedelic atmosphere; frequently features jangly guitars, looping basslines, four-bar drum patterns, and a hypnotic, carefree feel that originated in the Madchester scene of the late 1980s.

children.name: Dream Pop
children.description: Reverberated guitars, effects-laden vocals, and dense productions, creating a psychedelic, spacious, and dreamlike sound.

children.name: Hypnagogic Pop
children.description: 21st century style that refracts the pop culture of past decades through surreal, low-fidelity production and emulation of outdated media formats or equipment.

children.name: Paisley Underground
children.description: Emerged in Los Angeles in the early 1980s, featuring the energy of Power Pop and New Wave adorned with retro Psychedelia.

children.name: Space Rock Revival
children.description: Draws from the aesthetics and atmospheric soundscapes of Space Rock combined with the more minimal, back-to-basics approach of the Post-Punk era.
